page.title: 16The Oaks Farm, Burgess Hill
page.content: The{Oaks Poultry Farm}is on the east side of the B2112, just south of the Folders Lane crossroads. It has two and a half acres of land. The farm has about{30000 chickens. 500 chicks are bought in every week and 500 birds killed and sold, mainly to local butchers. 2000 turkeys are reared each year and at any one time the farm has 100 geese, 100 ducks and 100 pigs. There is a farm shop which sells mainly eggs.{About one hundred dozen {are sold every week.}The price for the largest eggs in July 1985 was Â£1 a dozen.
